laboratory_examinations.findings: Double-negative (CD3+CD4-CD8-) T cells constituted 32% of all CD3+ T cells, compared to less than 2% in normal donors.
3% of cells were positive for annexin V, as compared with 33% in one healthy subject.
A novel point mutation in intron 7 affecting a canonical splicing site was identified.
A point mutation in exon 3 (755A>G), causing a change from asparagine to serine at position 252 (N252S), was identified.
The levels of activity of natural killer cells and cytotoxic T cells were similar to those in healthy controls.
